intro: Peristylus grandis, commonly known as the grand peristyle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the tips of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Peristylus grandis is often found in rocky or sandy habitats across its native range in southern Africa.
